data.title: Mary Elizabeth (Faulkenberry) Gannon (abt.1845-1926)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Mary (Faulkenberry) Gannon born abt. 1845 Cannon, Tennessee, United States died 1926 Warren, Tennessee, United States including ancestors + descendants + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Mary Elizabeth Gannon formerly Faulkenberry aka Fortenberry

Born about 1845 in Cannon, Tennessee, United States

Ancestors

Daughter of James Faulkenberry and Margaret (Bragg) Faulkenberry

Sister of James G. Faulkenberry

Descendants

Died 15 Mar 1926 at about age 81 in Warren, Tennessee, United States

Profile last modified 2 Jul 2023 | Created 1 Jul 2023

This page has been accessed 44 times.

Biography

Mary was born in Cannon County, Tennessee, in about 1845, to James Faulkenberry and Margaret Bragg. Her father is believed to have died before 1850, because she, along with her mother and two siblings, were living in the home of her grandparents by that year.[1] [2] In 1870, Mary and her mother were living in the home of her sister, Isabella, and brother-in-law, Reese Sullivan.[3]

The family used several different spellings of their surname. Her parents' marriage record uses Faulkenberry/Faulkenberg. After her father's death, it is written Faulkenby, Fortonbury, Falambury, and Fortenberry on the different census records and Mary's own marriage record.

Mary married William Gannon, son of Samuel Gannon and Susannah Stacy, as his second wife, in 1875.[4] The couple had five known children:[5] [6]

1878: Margrett S, no recorded marriage, probably died young

1880-1969: Harriet Tennessee, m. Joseph N. Shirley, 1897

1881-1928: James Horace, m. 1st? Tisha Henderson, 1902; m. 2nd? Gertrude O'Kelley, 1903; m. 3rd? Mary Duncan Rayburn, 1914 (div.?)

1884-1966: Ballen/Ballo Lester, m. Nancy Bonner, 1906

1886-1955: Fannie Frances, m. Ed Mullins, 1901

William died in the winter of 1926, of "old age and Bright disease," an old term for kidney disease.[7] Mary followed him a month later.[8] They are buried together in the Old Philadelphia Cemetery in Vervilla, Tennessee.

Sources

↑ "United States Census, 1850," database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:MCD4-7CN : 23 December 2020), Mary Faulkenby in household of John Bragg, Cannon, Tennessee, United States; citing family , NARA microfilm publication (Washington, D.C.: National Archives and Records Administration, n.d.).

↑ "United States Census, 1860", database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:M8TW-S9P : 18 February 2021), Mary Fortonbury in entry for Elizabeth Bragg, 1860.

↑ "United States Census, 1870", database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:MD8V-SX3 : 29 May 2021), Mary E Falambury in entry for Reese F Sullivan, 1870.

↑ "Tennessee Marriages, 1796-1950", database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:XD3J-199 : 27 January 2020), Mary E. Fortenberry in entry for Wm. H. Gannon, 1875.

↑ "United States Census, 1880," database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:MDWJ-H75 : 15 January 2022), Mary E. Gannon in household of William Gannon, District 13, Grainger, Tennessee, United States; citing enumeration district , sheet , NARA microfilm publication T9 (Washington, D.C.: National Archives and Records Administration, n.d.), FHL microfilm.

↑ "United States Census, 1900", database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:MSZN-28W : 10 March 2022), Mary E Gannon in entry for William Gannon, 1900.
